meanings.definition: Relating to the eye or sense of sight.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an ocular device to examine my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The ocular nerves are crucial for vision.
meanings.sent3: I bought fancy ocular glasses that make everything look clearer.
meanings.sent4: Her ocular focus was so intense, it felt like she could see through walls.
meanings.sent5: The ocular view of the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: An eyepiece or lens for a microscope or other optical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The scientist adjusted the ocular to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: The microscope's ocular magnifies the specimen.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat played with the ocular of the telescope.
meanings.sent4: Through the ocular, the tiny details became crystal clear.
meanings.sent5: The ocular of the binoculars helped spot the rare bird.
